items.h1: Webentwicklung in Heilbronn
items.description: Professionelle Webentwicklung in Heilbronn, Baden-Württemberg. Heilbronn ist das wirtschaftliche Zentrum der Region Heilbronn-Franken und eine der bedeutendsten Städte in Baden-Württemberg. Als Käthchenstadt bekannt, vereint Heilbronn Weinkultur, Innovation und moderne Wirtschaftskraft.
items.keywords: Webdesign Agentur Heilbronn,App Entwicklung Heilbronn,Webentwicklung Heilbronn-Franken,Software Entwickler Heilbronn,Homepage erstellen Heilbronn,Responsive Webdesign Heilbronn,E-Commerce Heilbronn,Mobile App Entwicklung Heilbronn,React Developer Heilbronn,Next.js Agentur Heilbronn,Digitalagentur Heilbronn,Webdesign Neckarbogen

items.title: Webentwicklung Crailsheim | HEADON.pro
items.h1: Webentwicklung in Crailsheim
items.description: Professionelle Webentwicklung in Crailsheim, Baden-Württemberg. Crailsheim ist eine Industriestadt im Landkreis Schwäbisch Hall und ein bedeutender Standort für Maschinenbau und Verpackungstechnik. Mit drei Weltmarktführern vor Ort vereint die Stadt industrielle Innovation mit traditioneller Wirtschaftskraft.
items.keywords: Webdesign Agentur Crailsheim,App Entwicklung Schwäbisch Hall,Webentwicklung Crailsheim,Software Entwickler Crailsheim,B2B Website Crailsheim,Industrie Website Crailsheim,E-Commerce Crailsheim,Mobile App Entwicklung Hohenlohe,React Developer Crailsheim,Next.js Agentur Schwäbisch Hall

fields.name: lighthouse_first-contentful-paint
fields.description: Первая отрисовка контента – показатель, который определяет интервал времени между началом загрузки страницы и появлением первого изображения или блока текста. [Подробнее…](https://web.dev/first-contentful-paint/)

fields.name: lighthouse_speed-index
fields.description: Индекс скорости загрузки показывает, как быстро на странице появляется контент. [Подробнее…](https://web.dev/speed-index/)

fields.name: lighthouse_largest-contentful-paint
fields.description: Отрисовка крупного контента – показатель, который определяет время, требуемое на полную отрисовку крупного текста или изображения. [Подробнее…](https://web.dev/lighthouse-largest-contentful-paint/)

fields.name: lighthouse_interactive
fields.description: Время загрузки для взаимодействия – это время, в течение которого страница становится полностью готова к взаимодействию с пользователем. [Подробнее…](https://web.dev/interactive/)

fields.name: lighthouse_total-blocking-time
fields.description: Сумма (в миллисекундах) всех периодов от первой отрисовки контента до загрузки для взаимодействия, когда скорость выполнения задач превышала 50 мс. [Подробнее…](https://web.dev/lighthouse-total-blocking-time/)

fields.name: lighthouse_cumulative-layout-shift
fields.description: Совокупное смещение макета – это процентная величина, на которую смещаются видимые элементы области просмотра при загрузке. [Подробнее…](https://web.dev/cls/)

fields.name: lighthouse_first-cpu-idle
fields.description: First CPU Idle marks the first time at which the page's main thread is quiet enough to handle input.  [Learn more](https://web.dev/first-cpu-idle/).

fields.name: lighthouse_max-potential-fid
fields.description: The maximum potential First Input Delay that your users could experience is the duration of the longest task. [Learn more](https://web.dev/lighthouse-max-potential-fid/).

fields.name: lighthouse_first-meaningful-paint
fields.description: First Meaningful Paint measures when the primary content of a page is visible. [Learn more](https://web.dev/first-meaningful-paint/).

fields.name: lighthouse_estimated-input-latency
fields.description: Estimated Input Latency is an estimate of how long your app takes to respond to user input, in milliseconds, during the busiest 5s window of page load. If your latency is higher than 50 ms, users may perceive your app as laggy. [Learn more](https://web.dev/estimated-input-latency/).

fields.name: lighthouse_render-blocking-resources
fields.description: Resources are blocking the first paint of your page. Consider delivering critical JS/CSS inline and deferring all non-critical JS/styles. [Learn more](https://web.dev/render-blocking-resources/).

fields.name: lighthouse_uses-responsive-images
fields.description: Serve images that are appropriately-sized to save cellular data and improve load time. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-responsive-images/).

fields.name: lighthouse_offscreen-images
fields.description: Consider lazy-loading offscreen and hidden images after all critical resources have finished loading to lower time to interactive. [Learn more](https://web.dev/offscreen-images/).

fields.name: lighthouse_unminified-css
fields.description: Minifying CSS files can reduce network payload sizes. [Learn more](https://web.dev/unminified-css/).

fields.name: lighthouse_unminified-javascript
fields.description: Minifying JavaScript files can reduce payload sizes and script parse time. [Learn more](https://web.dev/unminified-javascript/).

fields.name: lighthouse_unused-css-rules
fields.description: Remove dead rules from stylesheets and defer the loading of CSS not used for above-the-fold content to reduce unnecessary bytes consumed by network activity. [Learn more](https://web.dev/unused-css-rules/).

fields.name: lighthouse_unused-javascript
fields.description: Remove unused JavaScript to reduce bytes consumed by network activity. [Learn more](https://web.dev/unused-javascript/).

fields.name: lighthouse_uses-optimized-images
fields.description: Optimized images load faster and consume less cellular data. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-optimized-images/).

fields.name: lighthouse_uses-webp-images
fields.description: Image formats like JPEG 2000, JPEG XR, and WebP often provide better compression than PNG or JPEG, which means faster downloads and less data consumption. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-webp-images/).

fields.name: lighthouse_uses-text-compression
fields.description: Text-based resources should be served with compression (gzip, deflate or brotli) to minimize total network bytes. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-text-compression/).

fields.name: lighthouse_uses-rel-preconnect
fields.description: Consider adding `preconnect` or `dns-prefetch` resource hints to establish early connections to important third-party origins. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-rel-preconnect/).

fields.name: lighthouse_server-response-time
fields.comment: Initial server response time was short
fields.description: Keep the server response time for the main document short because all other requests depend on it. [Learn more](https://web.dev/time-to-first-byte/).

fields.name: lighthouse_redirects
fields.description: Redirects introduce additional delays before the page can be loaded. [Learn more](https://web.dev/redirects/).

fields.name: lighthouse_uses-rel-preload
fields.description: Consider using `<link rel=preload>` to prioritize fetching resources that are currently requested later in page load. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-rel-preload/).

fields.name: lighthouse_uses-http2
fields.description: HTTP/2 offers many benefits over HTTP/1.1, including binary headers, multiplexing, and server push. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-http2/).

fields.name: lighthouse_efficient-animated-content
fields.comment: Use video formats for animated content
fields.description: Large GIFs are inefficient for delivering animated content. Consider using MPEG4/WebM videos for animations and PNG/WebP for static images instead of GIF to save network bytes. [Learn more](https://web.dev/efficient-animated-content/)

fields.name: lighthouse_duplicated-javascript
fields.comment: Remove duplicate modules in JavaScript bundles
fields.description: Remove large, duplicate JavaScript modules from bundles to reduce unnecessary bytes consumed by network activity.

fields.name: lighthouse_legacy-javascript
fields.comment: Avoid serving legacy JavaScript to modern browsers
fields.description: Polyfills and transforms enable legacy browsers to use new JavaScript features. However, many aren't necessary for modern browsers. For your bundled JavaScript, adopt a modern script deployment strategy using module/nomodule feature detection to reduce the amount of code shipped to modern browsers, while retaining support for legacy browsers. [Learn More](https://philipwalton.com/articles/deploying-es2015-code-in-production-today/)

fields.name: lighthouse_total-byte-weight
fields.description: Large network payloads cost users real money and are highly correlated with long load times. [Learn more](https://web.dev/total-byte-weight/).

fields.name: lighthouse_uses-long-cache-ttl
fields.comment: Uses efficient cache policy on static assets
fields.description: A long cache lifetime can speed up repeat visits to your page. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-long-cache-ttl/).

fields.name: lighthouse_dom-size
fields.description: A large DOM will increase memory usage, cause longer [style calculations](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/performance/rendering/reduce-the-scope-and-complexity-of-style-calculations), and produce costly [layout reflows](https://developers.google.com/speed/articles/reflow). [Learn more](https://web.dev/dom-size/).

fields.name: lighthouse_critical-request-chains
fields.description: The Critical Request Chains below show you what resources are loaded with a high priority. Consider reducing the length of chains, reducing the download size of resources, or deferring the download of unnecessary resources to improve page load. [Learn more](https://web.dev/critical-request-chains/).

fields.name: lighthouse_user-timings
fields.description: Consider instrumenting your app with the User Timing API to measure your app's real-world performance during key user experiences. [Learn more](https://web.dev/user-timings/).

fields.name: lighthouse_bootup-time
fields.description: Consider reducing the time spent parsing, compiling, and executing JS. You may find delivering smaller JS payloads helps with this. [Learn more](https://web.dev/bootup-time/).

fields.name: lighthouse_mainthread-work-breakdown
fields.description: Consider reducing the time spent parsing, compiling and executing JS. You may find delivering smaller JS payloads helps with this. [Learn more](https://web.dev/mainthread-work-breakdown/)

fields.name: lighthouse_font-display
fields.comment: All text remains visible during webfont loads
fields.description: Leverage the font-display CSS feature to ensure text is user-visible while webfonts are loading. [Learn more](https://web.dev/font-display/).

fields.name: lighthouse_performance-budget
fields.description: Keep the quantity and size of network requests under the targets set by the provided performance budget. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/budgets).

fields.name: lighthouse_timing-budget
fields.description: Set a timing budget to help you keep an eye on the performance of your site. Performant sites load fast and respond to user input events quickly. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/budgets).

fields.name: lighthouse_resource-summary
fields.comment: Keep request counts low and transfer sizes small
fields.description: To set budgets for the quantity and size of page resources, add a budget.json file. [Learn more](https://web.dev/use-lighthouse-for-performance-budgets/).

fields.name: lighthouse_third-party-summary
fields.description: Third-party code can significantly impact load performance. Limit the number of redundant third-party providers and try to load third-party code after your page has primarily finished loading. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/performance/optimizing-content-efficiency/loading-third-party-javascript/).

fields.name: lighthouse_largest-contentful-paint-element
fields.description: This is the largest contentful element painted within the viewport. [Learn More](https://web.dev/lighthouse-largest-contentful-paint/)

fields.name: lighthouse_layout-shift-elements
fields.description: These DOM elements contribute most to the CLS of the page.

fields.name: lighthouse_uses-passive-event-listeners
fields.comment: Uses passive listeners to improve scrolling performance
fields.description: Consider marking your touch and wheel event listeners as `passive` to improve your page's scroll performance. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-passive-event-listeners/).

fields.name: lighthouse_no-document-write
fields.description: For users on slow connections, external scripts dynamically injected via `document.write()` can delay page load by tens of seconds. [Learn more](https://web.dev/no-document-write/).

fields.name: lighthouse_long-tasks
fields.description: Lists the longest tasks on the main thread, useful for identifying worst contributors to input delay. [Learn more](https://web.dev/long-tasks-devtools/)

fields.name: lighthouse_non-composited-animations
fields.description: Animations which are not composited can be janky and contribute to CLS. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/performance/rendering/stick-to-compositor-only-properties-and-manage-layer-count)

fields.name: lighthouse_unsized-images
fields.description: Set an explicit width and height on image elements to reduce layout shifts and improve CLS. [Learn more](https://web.dev/optimize-cls/#images-without-dimensions)

fields.name: lighthouse_network-requests
fields.description: Lists the network requests that were made during page load.

fields.name: lighthouse_network-rtt
fields.description: Network round trip times (RTT) have a large impact on performance. If the RTT to an origin is high, it's an indication that servers closer to the user could improve performance. [Learn more](https://hpbn.co/primer-on-latency-and-bandwidth/).

fields.name: lighthouse_network-server-latency
fields.description: Server latencies can impact web performance. If the server latency of an origin is high, it's an indication the server is overloaded or has poor backend performance. [Learn more](https://hpbn.co/primer-on-web-performance/#analyzing-the-resource-waterfall).

fields.name: lighthouse_main-thread-tasks
fields.description: Lists the toplevel main thread tasks that executed during page load.

fields.name: lighthouse_diagnostics
fields.description: Collection of useful page vitals.

fields.name: lighthouse_metrics
fields.description: Collects all available metrics.

fields.name: lighthouse_screenshot-thumbnails
fields.description: This is what the load of your site looked like.

fields.name: lighthouse_final-screenshot
fields.description: The last screenshot captured of the pageload.

fields.name: lighthouse_accesskeys
fields.description: Access keys let users quickly focus a part of the page. For proper navigation, each access key must be unique. [Learn more](https://web.dev/accesskeys/).

fields.name: lighthouse_aria-allowed-attr
fields.description: Each ARIA `role` supports a specific subset of `aria-*` attributes. Mismatching these invalidates the `aria-*` attributes. [Learn more](https://web.dev/aria-allowed-attr/).

fields.name: lighthouse_aria-hidden-body
fields.comment: `[aria-hidden="true"]` is not present on the document `<body>`
fields.description: Assistive technologies, like screen readers, work inconsistently when `aria-hidden="true"` is set on the document `<body>`. [Learn more](https://web.dev/aria-hidden-body/).

fields.name: lighthouse_aria-hidden-focus
fields.comment: `[aria-hidden="true"]` elements do not contain focusable descendents
fields.description: Focusable descendents within an `[aria-hidden="true"]` element prevent those interactive elements from being available to users of assistive technologies like screen readers. [Learn more](https://web.dev/aria-hidden-focus/).

fields.name: lighthouse_aria-input-field-name
fields.comment: ARIA input fields have accessible names
fields.description: When an input field doesn't have an accessible name, screen readers announce it with a generic name, making it unusable for users who rely on screen readers. [Learn more](https://web.dev/aria-input-field-name/).

fields.name: lighthouse_aria-required-attr
fields.description: Some ARIA roles have required attributes that describe the state of the element to screen readers. [Learn more](https://web.dev/aria-required-attr/).

fields.name: lighthouse_aria-required-children
fields.comment: Elements with an ARIA `[role]` that require children to contain a specific `[role]` have all required children.
fields.description: Some ARIA parent roles must contain specific child roles to perform their intended accessibility functions. [Learn more](https://web.dev/aria-required-children/).

fields.name: lighthouse_aria-required-parent
fields.comment: `[role]`s are contained by their required parent element
fields.description: Some ARIA child roles must be contained by specific parent roles to properly perform their intended accessibility functions. [Learn more](https://web.dev/aria-required-parent/).

fields.name: lighthouse_aria-roles
fields.description: ARIA roles must have valid values in order to perform their intended accessibility functions. [Learn more](https://web.dev/aria-roles/).

fields.name: lighthouse_aria-toggle-field-name
fields.comment: ARIA toggle fields have accessible names
fields.description: When a toggle field doesn't have an accessible name, screen readers announce it with a generic name, making it unusable for users who rely on screen readers. [Learn more](https://web.dev/aria-toggle-field-name/).

fields.name: lighthouse_aria-valid-attr-value
fields.description: Assistive technologies, like screen readers, can't interpret ARIA attributes with invalid values. [Learn more](https://web.dev/aria-valid-attr-value/).

fields.name: lighthouse_aria-valid-attr
fields.comment: `[aria-*]` attributes are valid and not misspelled
fields.description: Assistive technologies, like screen readers, can't interpret ARIA attributes with invalid names. [Learn more](https://web.dev/aria-valid-attr/).

fields.name: lighthouse_button-name
fields.description: When a button doesn't have an accessible name, screen readers announce it as "button", making it unusable for users who rely on screen readers. [Learn more](https://web.dev/button-name/).

fields.name: lighthouse_bypass
fields.comment: The page contains a heading, skip link, or landmark region
fields.description: Adding ways to bypass repetitive content lets keyboard users navigate the page more efficiently. [Learn more](https://web.dev/bypass/).

fields.name: lighthouse_color-contrast
fields.comment: Background and foreground colors have a sufficient contrast ratio
fields.description: Low-contrast text is difficult or impossible for many users to read. [Learn more](https://web.dev/color-contrast/).

fields.name: lighthouse_definition-list
fields.comment: `<dl>`'s contain only properly-ordered `<dt>` and `<dd>` groups, `<script>`, `<template>` or `<div>` elements.
fields.description: When definition lists are not properly marked up, screen readers may produce confusing or inaccurate output. [Learn more](https://web.dev/definition-list/).

fields.name: lighthouse_dlitem
fields.comment: Definition list items are wrapped in `<dl>` elements
fields.description: Definition list items (`<dt>` and `<dd>`) must be wrapped in a parent `<dl>` element to ensure that screen readers can properly announce them. [Learn more](https://web.dev/dlitem/).

fields.name: lighthouse_document-title
fields.description: The title gives screen reader users an overview of the page, and search engine users rely on it heavily to determine if a page is relevant to their search. [Learn more](https://web.dev/document-title/).

fields.name: lighthouse_duplicate-id-active
fields.comment: `[id]` attributes on active, focusable elements are unique
fields.description: All focusable elements must have a unique `id` to ensure that they're visible to assistive technologies. [Learn more](https://web.dev/duplicate-id-active/).

fields.name: lighthouse_duplicate-id-aria
fields.description: The value of an ARIA ID must be unique to prevent other instances from being overlooked by assistive technologies. [Learn more](https://web.dev/duplicate-id-aria/).

fields.name: lighthouse_form-field-multiple-labels
fields.comment: No form fields have multiple labels
fields.description: Form fields with multiple labels can be confusingly announced by assistive technologies like screen readers which use either the first, the last, or all of the labels. [Learn more](https://web.dev/form-field-multiple-labels/).

fields.name: lighthouse_frame-title
fields.description: Screen reader users rely on frame titles to describe the contents of frames. [Learn more](https://web.dev/frame-title/).

fields.name: lighthouse_heading-order
fields.comment: Heading elements appear in a sequentially-descending order
fields.description: Properly ordered headings that do not skip levels convey the semantic structure of the page, making it easier to navigate and understand when using assistive technologies. [Learn more](https://web.dev/heading-order/).

fields.name: lighthouse_html-has-lang
fields.comment: `<html>` element does not have a `[lang]` attribute
fields.description: If a page doesn't specify a lang attribute, a screen reader assumes that the page is in the default language that the user chose when setting up the screen reader. If the page isn't actually in the default language, then the screen reader might not announce the page's text correctly. [Learn more](https://web.dev/html-has-lang/).

fields.name: lighthouse_html-lang-valid
fields.comment: `<html>` element has a valid value for its `[lang]` attribute
fields.description: Specifying a valid [BCP 47 language](https://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-choosing-language-tags#question) helps screen readers announce text properly. [Learn more](https://web.dev/html-lang-valid/).

fields.name: lighthouse_image-alt
fields.description: Informative elements should aim for short, descriptive alternate text. Decorative elements can be ignored with an empty alt attribute. [Learn more](https://web.dev/image-alt/).

fields.name: lighthouse_input-image-alt
fields.description: When an image is being used as an `<input>` button, providing alternative text can help screen reader users understand the purpose of the button. [Learn more](https://web.dev/input-image-alt/).

fields.name: lighthouse_label
fields.description: Labels ensure that form controls are announced properly by assistive technologies, like screen readers. [Learn more](https://web.dev/label/).

fields.name: lighthouse_layout-table
fields.comment: Presentational `<table>` elements avoid using `<th>`, `<caption>` or the `[summary]` attribute.
fields.description: A table being used for layout purposes should not include data elements, such as the th or caption elements or the summary attribute, because this can create a confusing experience for screen reader users. [Learn more](https://web.dev/layout-table/).

fields.name: lighthouse_link-name
fields.description: Link text (and alternate text for images, when used as links) that is discernible, unique, and focusable improves the navigation experience for screen reader users. [Learn more](https://web.dev/link-name/).

fields.name: lighthouse_list
fields.comment: Lists contain only `<li>` elements and script supporting elements (`<script>` and `<template>`).
fields.description: Screen readers have a specific way of announcing lists. Ensuring proper list structure aids screen reader output. [Learn more](https://web.dev/list/).

fields.name: lighthouse_listitem
fields.comment: List items (`<li>`) are contained within `<ul>` or `<ol>` parent elements
fields.description: Screen readers require list items (`<li>`) to be contained within a parent `<ul>` or `<ol>` to be announced properly. [Learn more](https://web.dev/listitem/).

fields.name: lighthouse_meta-refresh
fields.comment: The document does not use `<meta http-equiv="refresh">`
fields.description: Users do not expect a page to refresh automatically, and doing so will move focus back to the top of the page. This may create a frustrating or confusing experience. [Learn more](https://web.dev/meta-refresh/).

fields.name: lighthouse_meta-viewport
fields.comment: `[user-scalable="no"]` is not used in the `<meta name="viewport">` element and the `[maximum-scale]` attribute is not less than 5.
fields.description: Disabling zooming is problematic for users with low vision who rely on screen magnification to properly see the contents of a web page. [Learn more](https://web.dev/meta-viewport/).

fields.name: lighthouse_object-alt
fields.description: Screen readers cannot translate non-text content. Adding alt text to `<object>` elements helps screen readers convey meaning to users. [Learn more](https://web.dev/object-alt/).

fields.name: lighthouse_tabindex
fields.comment: No element has a `[tabindex]` value greater than 0
fields.description: A value greater than 0 implies an explicit navigation ordering. Although technically valid, this often creates frustrating experiences for users who rely on assistive technologies. [Learn more](https://web.dev/tabindex/).

fields.name: lighthouse_td-headers-attr
fields.comment: Cells in a `<table>` element that use the `[headers]` attribute refer to table cells within the same table.
fields.description: Screen readers have features to make navigating tables easier. Ensuring `<td>` cells using the `[headers]` attribute only refer to other cells in the same table may improve the experience for screen reader users. [Learn more](https://web.dev/td-headers-attr/).

fields.name: lighthouse_th-has-data-cells
fields.comment: `<th>` elements and elements with `[role="columnheader"/"rowheader"]` have data cells they describe.
fields.description: Screen readers have features to make navigating tables easier. Ensuring table headers always refer to some set of cells may improve the experience for screen reader users. [Learn more](https://web.dev/th-has-data-cells/).

fields.name: lighthouse_valid-lang
fields.description: Specifying a valid [BCP 47 language](https://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-choosing-language-tags#question) on elements helps ensure that text is pronounced correctly by a screen reader. [Learn more](https://web.dev/valid-lang/).

fields.name: lighthouse_video-caption
fields.description: When a video provides a caption it is easier for deaf and hearing impaired users to access its information. [Learn more](https://web.dev/video-caption/).

fields.name: lighthouse_video-description
fields.description: Audio descriptions provide relevant information for videos that dialogue cannot, such as facial expressions and scenes. [Learn more](https://web.dev/video-description/).

fields.name: lighthouse_logical-tab-order
fields.comment: The page has a logical tab order
fields.description: Tabbing through the page follows the visual layout. Users cannot focus elements that are offscreen. [Learn more](https://web.dev/logical-tab-order/).

fields.name: lighthouse_focusable-controls
fields.description: Custom interactive controls are keyboard focusable and display a focus indicator. [Learn more](https://web.dev/focusable-controls/).

fields.name: lighthouse_interactive-element-affordance
fields.comment: Interactive elements indicate their purpose and state
fields.description: Interactive elements, such as links and buttons, should indicate their state and be distinguishable from non-interactive elements. [Learn more](https://web.dev/interactive-element-affordance/).

fields.name: lighthouse_managed-focus
fields.comment: The user's focus is directed to new content added to the page
fields.description: If new content, such as a dialog, is added to the page, the user's focus is directed to it. [Learn more](https://web.dev/managed-focus/).

fields.name: lighthouse_focus-traps
fields.comment: User focus is not accidentally trapped in a region
fields.description: A user can tab into and out of any control or region without accidentally trapping their focus. [Learn more](https://web.dev/focus-traps/).

fields.name: lighthouse_custom-controls-labels
fields.description: Custom interactive controls have associated labels, provided by aria-label or aria-labelledby. [Learn more](https://web.dev/custom-controls-labels/).

fields.name: lighthouse_custom-controls-roles
fields.description: Custom interactive controls have appropriate ARIA roles. [Learn more](https://web.dev/custom-control-roles/).

fields.name: lighthouse_visual-order-follows-dom
fields.comment: Visual order on the page follows DOM order
fields.description: DOM order matches the visual order, improving navigation for assistive technology. [Learn more](https://web.dev/visual-order-follows-dom/).

fields.name: lighthouse_offscreen-content-hidden
fields.comment: Offscreen content is hidden from assistive technology
fields.description: Offscreen content is hidden with display: none or aria-hidden=true. [Learn more](https://web.dev/offscreen-content-hidden/).

fields.name: lighthouse_use-landmarks
fields.comment: HTML5 landmark elements are used to improve navigation
fields.description: Landmark elements (<main>, <nav>, etc.) are used to improve the keyboard navigation of the page for assistive technology. [Learn more](https://web.dev/use-landmarks/).

fields.name: lighthouse_is-on-https
fields.description: All sites should be protected with HTTPS, even ones that don't handle sensitive data. This includes avoiding [mixed content](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/security/prevent-mixed-content/what-is-mixed-content), where some resources are loaded over HTTP despite the initial request being servedover HTTPS. HTTPS prevents intruders from tampering with or passively listening in on the communications between your app and your users, and is a prerequisite for HTTP/2 and many new web platform APIs. [Learn more](https://web.dev/is-on-https/).

fields.name: lighthouse_external-anchors-use-rel-noopener
fields.comment: Links to cross-origin destinations are safe
fields.description: Add `rel="noopener"` or `rel="noreferrer"` to any external links to improve performance and prevent security vulnerabilities. [Learn more](https://web.dev/external-anchors-use-rel-noopener/).

fields.name: lighthouse_geolocation-on-start
fields.comment: Avoids requesting the geolocation permission on page load
fields.description: Users are mistrustful of or confused by sites that request their location without context. Consider tying the request to a user action instead. [Learn more](https://web.dev/geolocation-on-start/).

fields.name: lighthouse_notification-on-start
fields.comment: Avoids requesting the notification permission on page load
fields.description: Users are mistrustful of or confused by sites that request to send notifications without context. Consider tying the request to user gestures instead. [Learn more](https://web.dev/notification-on-start/).

fields.name: lighthouse_no-vulnerable-libraries
fields.comment: Avoids front-end JavaScript libraries with known security vulnerabilities
fields.description: Some third-party scripts may contain known security vulnerabilities that are easily identified and exploited by attackers. [Learn more](https://web.dev/no-vulnerable-libraries/).

fields.name: lighthouse_password-inputs-can-be-pasted-into
fields.comment: Allows users to paste into password fields
fields.description: Preventing password pasting undermines good security policy. [Learn more](https://web.dev/password-inputs-can-be-pasted-into/).

fields.name: lighthouse_image-aspect-ratio
fields.comment: Displays images with correct aspect ratio
fields.description: Image display dimensions should match natural aspect ratio. [Learn more](https://web.dev/image-aspect-ratio/).

fields.name: lighthouse_image-size-responsive
fields.description: Image natural dimensions should be proportional to the display size and the pixel ratio to maximize image clarity. [Learn more](https://web.dev/serve-responsive-images/).

fields.name: lighthouse_doctype
fields.comment: Page lacks the HTML doctype, thus triggering quirks-mode
fields.description: Specifying a doctype prevents the browser from switching to quirks-mode. [Learn more](https://web.dev/doctype/).

fields.name: lighthouse_charset
fields.comment: Charset declaration is missing or occurs too late in the HTML
fields.description: A character encoding declaration is required. It can be done with a <meta> tag in the first 1024 bytes of the HTML or in the Content-Type HTTP response header. [Learn more](https://web.dev/charset/).

fields.name: lighthouse_no-unload-listeners
fields.description: The `unload` event does not fire reliably and listening for it can prevent browser optimizations like the Back-Forward Cache. Consider using the `pagehide` or `visibilitychange` events instead. [Learn More](https://developers.google.com/web/updates/2018/07/page-lifecycle-api#the-unload-event)

fields.name: lighthouse_appcache-manifest
fields.description: Application Cache is deprecated. [Learn more](https://web.dev/appcache-manifest/).

fields.name: lighthouse_js-libraries
fields.description: All front-end JavaScript libraries detected on the page. [Learn more](https://web.dev/js-libraries/).

fields.name: lighthouse_deprecations
fields.description: Deprecated APIs will eventually be removed from the browser. [Learn more](https://web.dev/deprecations/).

fields.name: lighthouse_errors-in-console
fields.comment: No browser errors logged to the console
fields.description: Errors logged to the console indicate unresolved problems. They can come from network request failures and other browser concerns. [Learn more](https://web.dev/errors-in-console/)

fields.name: lighthouse_viewport
fields.comment: Does not have a `<meta name="viewport">` tag with `width` or `initial-scale`
fields.description: Add a `<meta name="viewport">` tag to optimize your app for mobile screens. [Learn more](https://web.dev/viewport/).

fields.name: lighthouse_meta-description
fields.comment: Document does not have a meta description
fields.description: Meta descriptions may be included in search results to concisely summarize page content. [Learn more](https://web.dev/meta-description/).

fields.name: lighthouse_http-status-code
fields.comment: Page has successful HTTP status code
fields.description: Pages with unsuccessful HTTP status codes may not be indexed properly. [Learn more](https://web.dev/http-status-code/).

fields.name: lighthouse_link-text
fields.description: Descriptive link text helps search engines understand your content. [Learn more](https://web.dev/link-text/).

fields.name: lighthouse_crawlable-anchors
fields.description: Search engines may use `href` attributes on links to crawl websites. Ensure that the `href` attribute of anchor elements links to an appropriate destination, so more pages of the site can be discovered. [Learn More](https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/9112205)

fields.name: lighthouse_is-crawlable
fields.description: Search engines are unable to include your pages in search results if they don't have permission to crawl them. [Learn more](https://web.dev/is-crawable/).

fields.name: lighthouse_robots-txt
fields.description: If your robots.txt file is malformed, crawlers may not be able to understand how you want your website to be crawled or indexed. [Learn more](https://web.dev/robots-txt/).

fields.name: lighthouse_hreflang
fields.description: hreflang links tell search engines what version of a page they should list in search results for a given language or region. [Learn more](https://web.dev/hreflang/).

fields.name: lighthouse_canonical
fields.description: Canonical links suggest which URL to show in search results. [Learn more](https://web.dev/canonical/).

fields.name: lighthouse_font-size
fields.comment: Document doesn't use legible font sizes
fields.description: Font sizes less than 12px are too small to be legible and require mobile visitors to “pinch to zoom” in order to read. Strive to have >60% of page text ≥12px. [Learn more](https://web.dev/font-size/).

fields.name: lighthouse_plugins
fields.description: Search engines can't index plugin content, and many devices restrict plugins or don't support them. [Learn more](https://web.dev/plugins/).

fields.name: lighthouse_tap-targets
fields.comment: Tap targets are not sized appropriately
fields.description: Interactive elements like buttons and links should be large enough (48x48px), and have enough space around them, to be easy enough to tap without overlapping onto other elements. [Learn more](https://web.dev/tap-targets/).

fields.name: lighthouse_structured-data
fields.description: Run the [Structured Data Testing Tool](https://search.google.com/structured-data/testing-tool/) and the [Structured Data Linter](http://linter.structured-data.org/) to validate structured data. [Learn more](https://web.dev/structured-data/).

fields.name: lighthouse_load-fast-enough-for-pwa
fields.comment: Page load is fast enough on mobile networks
fields.description: A fast page load over a cellular network ensures a good mobile user experience. [Learn more](https://web.dev/load-fast-enough-for-pwa/).
groups: Progressive Web App: Fast and reliable

fields.name: lighthouse_works-offline
fields.comment: Current page does not respond with a 200 when offline
fields.description: If you're building a Progressive Web App, consider using a service worker so that your app can work offline. [Learn more](https://web.dev/works-offline/).
groups: Progressive Web App: Fast and reliable

fields.name: lighthouse_offline-start-url
fields.comment: `start_url` does not respond with a 200 when offline
fields.description: A service worker enables your web app to be reliable in unpredictable network conditions. [Learn more](https://web.dev/offline-start-url/).
groups: Progressive Web App: Fast and reliable

fields.name: lighthouse_service-worker
fields.comment: Does not register a service worker that controls page and `start_url`
fields.description: The service worker is the technology that enables your app to use many Progressive Web App features, such as offline, add to homescreen, and push notifications. [Learn more](https://web.dev/service-worker/).

fields.name: lighthouse_installable-manifest
fields.comment: Web app manifest does not meet the installability requirements
fields.description: Browsers can proactively prompt users to add your app to their homescreen, which can lead to higher engagement. [Learn more](https://web.dev/installable-manifest/).

fields.name: lighthouse_redirects-http
fields.comment: Does not redirect HTTP traffic to HTTPS
fields.description: If you've already set up HTTPS, make sure that you redirect all HTTP traffic to HTTPS in order to enable secure web features for all your users. [Learn more](https://web.dev/redirects-http/).

fields.name: lighthouse_splash-screen
fields.comment: Is not configured for a custom splash screen
fields.description: A themed splash screen ensures a high-quality experience when users launch your app from their homescreens. [Learn more](https://web.dev/splash-screen/).

fields.name: lighthouse_themed-omnibox
fields.comment: Does not set a theme color for the address bar.
fields.description: The browser address bar can be themed to match your site. [Learn more](https://web.dev/themed-omnibox/).

fields.name: lighthouse_content-width
fields.comment: Content is not sized correctly for the viewport
fields.description: If the width of your app's content doesn't match the width of the viewport, your app might not be optimized for mobile screens. [Learn more](https://web.dev/content-width/).

fields.name: lighthouse_without-javascript
fields.comment: Contains some content when JavaScript is not available
fields.description: Your app should display some content when JavaScript is disabled, even if it's just a warning to the user that JavaScript is required to use the app. [Learn more](https://web.dev/without-javascript/).

fields.name: lighthouse_apple-touch-icon
fields.description: For ideal appearance on iOS when users add a progressive web app to the home screen, define an `apple-touch-icon`. It must point to a non-transparent 192px (or 180px) square PNG. [Learn More](https://web.dev/apple-touch-icon/).

fields.name: lighthouse_maskable-icon
fields.comment: Manifest doesn't have a maskable icon
fields.description: A maskable icon ensures that the image fills the entire shape without being letterboxed when installing the app on a device. [Learn more](https://web.dev/maskable-icon-audit/).

fields.name: lighthouse_pwa-cross-browser
fields.description: To reach the most number of users, sites should work across every major browser. [Learn more](https://web.dev/pwa-cross-browser/).

fields.name: lighthouse_pwa-page-transitions
fields.comment: Page transitions don't feel like they block on the network
fields.description: Transitions should feel snappy as you tap around, even on a slow network. This experience is key to a user's perception of performance. [Learn more](https://web.dev/pwa-page-transitions/).

fields.name: lighthouse_pwa-each-page-has-url
fields.description: Ensure individual pages are deep linkable via URL and that URLs are unique for the purpose of shareability on social media. [Learn more](https://web.dev/pwa-each-page-has-url/).
